name: search_google_shopping
description: Search Google Shopping for product listings and shopping results

q.description: Required. Parameter defines the query you want to search. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Google Shopping search.
q.title: Q

location.description: Parameter defines from where you want the search to originate. If several locations match the location requested, we'll pick the most popular one. Head to the /locations.json API if you need more precise control. The location and uule parameters can't be used together. It is recommended to specify location at the city level in order to simulate a real userâ€™s search. If location is omitted, the search may take on the location of the proxy.
location.title: Location

tbs.description: Optional. Defines advanced search parameters not possible in regular queries.
tbs.title: Tbs

shoprs.description: Optional. Helper ID for setting search filters. Must be used with updated q parameter containing filter names.
shoprs.title: Shoprs

direct_link.description: Optional. When true, attempts to include direct product links (may increase search time). Only applies to new layout countries.
direct_link.title: Direct Link

start.description: Optional. Result offset for pagination (e.g., 0=first page, 60=second page). Not recommended for new layout.
start.title: Start

num.description: Optional. Maximum results to return (1-100, default=60). Not supported in new layout.
num.title: Num

device.description: Optional. Device type for results: desktop (default), tablet, or mobile.
device.title: Device

no_cache.description: Optional. When true, forces fresh results ignoring cached versions. Cannot be used with async.
no_cache.title: No Cache

aasync.description: Optional. When true, submits search asynchronously. Cannot be used with no_cache or Ludicrous Speed accounts.
aasync.title: Aasync

zero_trace.description: Optional. Enterprise only. When true, enables ZeroTrace mode (no server storage).
zero_trace.title: Zero Trace
